response: the german government has taken steps to ensure that the protection of personal data is respected. the new general data protection regulation (gdpr) was implemented in may 2018, giving users more control over how their data is used. companies must get explicit consent from users before collecting and processing their personal data, and they can be fined if they do not comply with these regulations. in addition, the german government has created a new office to oversee data protection laws. these measures have made it easier for people in germany to protect their privacy online and ensure that their personal information is used ethically.<|endoftext|>
